name: anchovy, capture by steel purse seiner and landing whole, fresh | landed anchovy, fresh | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20543/documentation

This activity represents the purse seining operations to capture and land European anchovy (Engraulis encrasicolus) in the region of Cantabria, in northern Spain. All the anchovy is landed fresh, but then only 50% is consumed fresh. An additional 25% is sent to the local industry to produce canned anchovy-based products, whereas the remaining 25% is used to produce salted anchovy.  These purse seiners target European anchovy, but they also capture other species, such as mackerel (Scomber spp.), European pilchard (Sardina pilchardus) and, to a lesser extent, some types of tunids. Fishing operations occur in the Bay of Biscay within the Spanish EEZ. A total of 41 vessels belonged in 2015 to this fleet. ;

From vessel use and maintenance phases, including all upstream activities.

Port landing operations are excluded from the system boundary.

The system is unallocated between anchovy landings and the by-catch.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data corresponds to the landings of the average vessel of the Cantabrian purse seining fleet in 2015.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: European anchovy (Engraulis encrasicolus) is captured in the Spanish EEZ in the Cantabrian Sea.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology deployed in Spain includes purse seining and fish detection equipment.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Valid for other anchovy-landing purse seining fleets in the Cantabrian Sea in Spain (e.g., Asturias, Basque Country or Galicia). If extrapolated to other geographical locations, uncertainty should be adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description: Fresh whole European anchovy (Engraulis encrasicolus) captured in the Cantabrian Sea within the Spanish EEZ and landed for fresh consumption and canning.

exchanges.description: Construction of a purse seiner, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW). Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a purse seiner's LSW. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication.
